by automatically handling context retrieval and specification evaluation.
The
property wrapper simplifies specification usage by:
Automatically retrieving context from a provider
Evaluating the specification against that context
Providing a boolean result as a simple property
The specification is evaluated each time the
is accessed.
For expensive specifications, consider using
instead.
The wrapped value is computed on each access, so expensive specifications may impact performance.
Ensure the specification and context provider are thread-safe if used in concurrent environments.
A property wrapper that provides declarative specification evaluation with boolean results.

enables clean, readable specification usage by automatically handling context retrieval and specification evaluation. It transforms complex specification evaluation into simple boolean properties, making your code more expressive and maintainable.
Declarative Syntax
: Convert specification evaluation into readable property declarations
Automatic Context
: Handles context provider integration automatically
Multiple Initialization Patterns
: Supports specifications, predicates, and builders
Async Support
: Optional async evaluation through projected value
Type-Safe
: Compile-time safety for context and specification types
Composable
: Works with all specification types and operators
Use
when you need to:
Convert specification evaluation into properties
Simplify boolean condition checking
Create declarative feature flags or eligibility checks
Automatically manage context provider access
Build reactive UIs based on specification results

code: @Satisfies(context: myContext, using: DateRangeSpec(start: startDate, end: endDate))

inlineContent.text: The property wrapper evaluates the specification each time the property is accessed:

code: if canRetry {  // Re-evaluates with updated context
// Premium user OR trial user with remaining days

inlineContent.text: Create complex specifications using the builder API:
Access async evaluation through the projected value:

code: return true  // Priority requests bypass rate limits

Test property wrapper usage with

code: // Create specification that uses the provider
// ✅ Good - simple predicate for inline logic
// ✅ Better - cache or use alternative approach
// ✅ Good - use shared provider for simple cases
// ✅ Good - custom provider for specific needs
// ✅ Good - manual context for testing or special cases

inlineContent.text: Evaluation on Access
: Specification is evaluated each time the property is accessed
Context Fetching
: Context is fetched from provider on each evaluation
No Caching
: No automatic caching of results; re-evaluates every time
Lightweight Specs
: Use simple specifications for properties accessed frequently
Async Overhead
: Async evaluation via projected value has async context fetching overhead
Provider Cost
: Context provider performance affects property access performance
Consider using cached variants or manual caching for expensive evaluations:

abstract.text: A property wrapper that provides declarative specification evaluation.
Projected value to access helper methods like evaluateAsync.
Creates a Satisfies property wrapper using the shared default context provider
Creates a Satisfies property wrapper with a manual context value and specification.

Creates a Satisfies property wrapper with a custom context provider and specification.
Creates a specification for flag-based conditions

A property wrapper that evaluates decision specifications and always returns a non-optional result.
A property wrapper that provides declarative specification evaluation.
Creates a Satisfies property wrapper from a simple boolean predicate with no context

A specification that evaluates whether a context satisfies certain conditions.
A mock context provider designed for unit testing.
This provider allows you to set up specific context scenarios
and verify that specifications behave correctly under controlled conditions.
The wrapped value representing whether the specification is satisfied.
Creates a Satisfies property wrapper with a manual context and predicate closure.
A property wrapper that evaluates decision specifications and returns an optional result.
Creates a Satisfies property wrapper that combines multiple specifications with OR logic
Creates a Satisfies property wrapper with a custom context provider and specification type.
Creates a Satisfies property wrapper with a custom context provider and predicate function.
A context object that holds data needed for specification evaluation.
This serves as a container for all the information that specifications might need
to make their decisions, such as timestamps, counters, user state, etc.
Creates a Satisfies property wrapper with a manual context and specification type.
Creates a Satisfies property wrapper with a predicate using the shared default context provider
A property wrapper for asynchronously evaluating specifications with async context providers.
Async evaluation using the provider’s async context if available.
Creates a builder for constructing complex specifications
Creates a Satisfies property wrapper that combines multiple specifications with AND logic
Creates a specification for time-based conditions
Platform-independent core for building specification-based business logic in Swift.
